starProperties.name: Spectral Type
starProperties.desc: The spectral designation of a star.

starProperties.name: Color
starProperties.desc: The color of a star's light. Bluer stars are usually hotter while redder stars are cooler.

starProperties.name: Star Type
starProperties.desc: The luminosity/size class of a star. Ranges from hypergiant down to dwarf; Main Sequence stars are in the middle of the spectrum.

starProperties.name: Luminosity
starProperties.desc: The amount of energy emitted at the surface of a star.

starProperties.name: Apparent Magnitude
starProperties.desc: How bright a star appears from Earth.

starProperties.name: Absolute Magnitude
starProperties.desc: How bright a star appears from a standard distance of 10 parsecs.

position.name: Distance
position.desc: The distance a star is from Earth in light years.

position.name: Right Ascension
position.desc: The latitude of the celestial sphere: the angular distance measured eastward from the Sun's position at the vernal equinox.

position.name: Declination
position.desc: The longitude of the celestial sphere: the angular distance of a star north/south of the celestial equator as viewed from Earth.

dimensions.name: Mass
dimensions.desc: The total amount of matter contained in a star.

dimensions.name: Volume
dimensions.desc: The total amount of space occupied by a star.

dimensions.name: Mean Radius
dimensions.desc: The average distance between a star's center and its surface.

dimensions.name: Density
dimensions.desc: The ratio of mass to volume in a star; the amount of matter in a certain amount of space.

dimensions.name: Core Density
dimensions.desc: The ratio of mass to volume in a star's core.

rotation.name: Rotation Direction
rotation.desc: The direction of a star's spin on the "top" of the solar system's plane (the side containing Earth's north pole). Prograde means counterclockwise; retrograde means clockwise.

rotation.name: Rotation Period
rotation.desc: The total time taken for a star to complete one full rotation of its axis relative to the background stars (sidereal rotation).

rotation.name: Obliquity to Ecliptic
rotation.desc: The angle between a star's rotational axis and a line perpendicular to the Earth's orbital plane (ecliptic).

rotation.name: Speed Relative to Stars
rotation.desc: The speed a star (and its entire solar system) is moving relative to other stars in the background.

orbit.name: Orbiting
orbit.desc: The primary object which a component star in a multiple star system is orbiting.

orbit.name: Orbital Radius
orbit.desc: The distance between a star and the primary object it orbits.

orbit.name: Orbital Period
orbit.desc: The total time taken for a star to complete one full orbit in its multiple star system.

orbit.name: Orbital Velocity
orbit.desc: The velocity at which a star is moving relative to the object it orbits.

surface.name: Surface Gravity
surface.desc: The acceleration due to gravity experienced at the surface of a star.

surface.name: Escape Velocity
surface.desc: The minimum speed required for an object to escape the gravitational pull of a star.

surface.name: Surface Temperature
surface.desc: The average temperature in a star's chromosphere, the main layer of its atmosphere.

surface.name: Core Temperature
surface.desc: The average temperature in a star's core.

surface.name: Core Pressure
surface.desc: The average pressure in a star's core.

surface.name: Mass Conversion Rate
surface.desc: The rate at which mass is converted into energy through fusion in a star's core.

orbit.name: Orbiting
orbit.desc: The star which the planet is orbiting around.

orbit.name: Orbital Radius
orbit.desc: The average distance between a planet and its star (semi-major axis).

orbit.name: Perihelion
orbit.desc: The closest distance between a planet and its star during its orbit.

orbit.name: Aphelion
orbit.desc: The farthest distance between a planet and its star during its orbit.

orbit.name: Orbital Period
orbit.desc: The total time taken for a planet to complete one full orbit (sidereal period); the length of its year.

orbit.name: Orbital Velocity
orbit.desc: The average velocity at which a planet is moving on its orbit.

orbit.name: Orbital Inclination
orbit.desc: The angle between another planet's orbital plane and Earth's orbital plane (the ecliptic).

orbit.name: Orbital Eccentricity
orbit.desc: The measure of how elliptical a planet's orbit is. 0 indicates a perfect circular orbit, while values closer to 1 are more elliptical.

rotation.name: Rotation Direction
rotation.desc: The direction of a planet's spin on the "top" of the solar system's plane (the side containing Earth's north pole). Prograde means counterclockwise; retrograde means clockwise.

rotation.name: Rotation Period
rotation.desc: The total time taken for a planet to complete one full rotation of its axis relative to the background stars (sidereal rotation).

rotation.name: Length of Day
rotation.desc: The total time between instances of a planet's star appearing at the same position in the sky. Slightly different than its rotation period due to the planet's orbit around its star; for planets with longer rotation periods and shorter orbital periods, the day length differs greatly from the rotation period.

rotation.name: Obliquity to Orbit
rotation.desc: The angle between a planet's rotational axis and a line perpendicular to its orbital plane; axial tilt. 0ยบ means the planet rotates perpendicular to its orbit. This angle is the cause of seasons; angles closer to 90ยบ would cause greater seasonal variations.

dimensions.name: Mass
dimensions.desc: The total amount of matter contained in a planet.

dimensions.name: Volume
dimensions.desc: The total amount of space occupied by a planet.

dimensions.name: Mean Radius
dimensions.desc: The average distance between a planet's center and its surface.

dimensions.name: Equatorial Radius
dimensions.desc: The distance between a planet's center and its surface at its equator.

dimensions.name: Polar Radius
dimensions.desc: The distance between a planet's center and its surface at its poles.

dimensions.name: Core Radius
dimensions.desc: The distance between a planet's center and the edge of its core.

dimensions.name: Ellipticity
dimensions.desc: The measure of how elliptical a planet itself is; flattening. 0 indicates a perfect sphere, while values closer to 1 are more elliptical.

dimensions.name: Density
dimensions.desc: The ratio of mass to volume in a planet; the amount of matter in a certain amount of space.

surface.name: Surface Gravity
surface.desc: The acceleration due to gravity experienced at the surface of a planet.

surface.name: Escape Velocity
surface.desc: The minimum speed required for an object to escape the gravitational pull of a planet.

surface.name: Temperature
surface.desc: The average temperature at a planet's surface.

surface.name: Pressure
surface.desc: The average atmospheric pressure at a planet's surface. Values of 0 mean the planet has no atmosphere.

surface.name: Magnetic Field
surface.desc: If the planet contains a magnetic field.

orbit.name: Orbiting
orbit.desc: The planet which the moon is orbiting around.

orbit.name: Orbital Radius
orbit.desc: The average distance between a moon and the planet it orbits (semi-major axis).

orbit.name: Perigee
orbit.desc: The closest distance between a moon and its planet during its orbit.

orbit.name: Apogee
orbit.desc: The farthest distance between a moon and its planet during its orbit.

orbit.name: Orbital Direction
orbit.desc: The direction of a moon's orbit around its planet as viewed from the "top" of the solar system's plane (the side containing Earth's north pole). Prograde means counterclockwise; retrograde means clockwise.

orbit.name: Orbital Period
orbit.desc: The total time taken for a moon to complete one full orbit (sidereal period).

orbit.name: Orbital Velocity
orbit.desc: The average velocity at which a moon is moving on its orbit.

orbit.name: Orbital Inclination
orbit.desc: The angle between a moon's orbital plane and the orbital plane of the planet it orbits.

orbit.name: Inclination to Equator
orbit.desc: The angle between a moon's orbital plane and the equator of the planet it orbits.

orbit.name: Orbital Eccentricity
orbit.desc: The measure of how elliptical a moon's orbit is. 0 indicates a perfect circular orbit, while values closer to 1 are more elliptical.

rotation.name: Rotation Direction
rotation.desc: The direction of a moon's spin on the "top" of the solar system's plane (the side containing Earth's north pole). Prograde means counterclockwise; retrograde means clockwise.

rotation.name: Rotation Period
rotation.desc: The total time taken for a moon to complete one full rotation of its axis relative to the background stars. Some moons (like Earth's moon) have equivalent rotational and orbital periods, meaning they are tidally locked to their planet; only one side of the moon is ever visible from the planet.

rotation.name: Obliquity to Orbit
rotation.desc: The angle between a moon's rotational axis and a line perpendicular to its orbital plane; axial tilt. 0ยบ means the moon rotates perpendicular to its orbit.

rotation.name: Obliquity to Ecliptic
rotation.desc: The angle between a moon's rotational axis and a line perpendicular to the Earth's orbital plane (ecliptic).

rotation.name: Recession Rate
rotation.desc: The distance a moon moves away from its planet over a period of time. Negative values mean the moon is getting closer to its planet.

dimensions.name: Mass
dimensions.desc: The total amount of matter contained in a moon.

dimensions.name: Volume
dimensions.desc: The total amount of space occupied by a moon.

dimensions.name: Mean Radius
dimensions.desc: The average distance between a moon's center and its surface.

dimensions.name: Equatorial Radius
dimensions.desc: The distance between a moon's center and its surface at its equator.

dimensions.name: Polar Radius
dimensions.desc: The distance between a moon's center and its surface at its poles.

dimensions.name: Core Radius
dimensions.desc: The distance between a moon's center and the edge of its core.

dimensions.name: Ellipticity
dimensions.desc: The measure of how elliptical a moon itself is; flattening. 0 indicates a perfect sphere, while values closer to 1 are more elliptical.

dimensions.name: Density
dimensions.desc: The ratio of mass to volume in a moon; the amount of matter in a certain amount of space.

surface.name: Surface Gravity
surface.desc: The acceleration due to gravity experienced at the surface of a moon.

surface.name: Escape Velocity
surface.desc: The minimum speed required for an object to escape the gravitational pull of a moon.

surface.name: Temperature
surface.desc: The average temperature at a moon's surface.

surface.name: Pressure
surface.desc: The average atmospheric pressure at a moon's surface. Values of 0 mean the moon has no atmosphere.

surface.name: Magnetic Field
surface.desc: If the moon contains a magnetic field.

orbit.name: Orbiting
orbit.desc: The body which the object is orbiting around.

orbit.name: Orbital Radius
orbit.desc: The average distance between an object and the body it orbits (semi-major axis).

orbit.name: Perihelion
orbit.desc: The closest distance between an object and its orbiting body during its orbit.

orbit.name: Orbital Period
orbit.desc: The total time taken for an object to complete one full orbit (sidereal period).

orbit.name: Orbital Inclination
orbit.desc: The angle between an object's orbital plane and Earth's orbital plane.

orbit.name: Orbital Eccentricity
orbit.desc: The measure of how elliptical an object's orbit is. 0 indicates a perfect circular orbit, while values closer to 1 are more elliptical.

rotation.name: Rotation Period
rotation.desc: The total time taken for an object to complete one full rotation of its axis relative to the background stars (sidereal rotation).

dimensions.name: Mass
dimensions.desc: Total amount of matter contained in an object.

dimensions.name: Diameter
dimensions.desc: The average distance from one side of an object to the other.

dimensions.name: Size
dimensions.desc: The diameter of an object on each axis (used for non-spherical objects).
